name: Copy x (boolean value)
description: Copy boolean condition with specified result format.

in_ports.caption: x
in_ports.name: input
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] Should contain boolean scalar value, indication true/false condition.
See "What string is true" and "Default condition" parameters.

out_ports.caption: x
out_ports.name: output
out_ports.hint:
Copy of input boolean scalar.
Will be "true"/"false" string or "1"/"0" number, depending on "What string is true" parameter
(it is not a usual copy of the input string, like in "Copy scalar" function).

controls.caption: What string is true
controls.name: booleanStyle
controls.description:
What boolean value "x" is considered to be true and what is false.

C-like: true is non-zero number or non-empty string, containing not a number, false is 0, 0.0 or empty string.

Java-like: true is "true" string (ignoring case), false is any other string.

Note that "true" string, according these rules, is considered to be true in all modes.

controls.caption: Common input format
controls.name: commonInputStyle
controls.description:
If set, then input "x" may be specified both in C-like or in Java-like styles: it will always be recognized correctly.

In other words, if it is "true" or "false" string (ignoring case), it will be considered to be true/false correspondingly; if it is a number X, if will be translated to result of comparison Xâ‰ 0 (false for "0" or "0.0", true for non-zero numbers); it it is an empty string, it will be considered to false; in any other case (non-empty string, even consisting of spaces only) it will be true.

controls.caption: Default input
controls.name: defaultInput
controls.description: If the input "x" is non-initialized, this value is used instead of it.
